fields.description: This issue is being caused by a bug in the AutoconvertModuleDescriptor. The AutoconvertModuleDesciptor holds a reference to a MatcherBean, an AutoconvertBean, and a url. The AutoconvertBean *also* holds a reference to a list of associated MatcherBeans.  Because this is serialised and loaded onto the page, this bug manifests on the front end by loading a big chunk of duplicated autoconvert definitions, which negatively affects page weight.
fields.summary: Autoconvert matchers massively duplicated on the front end

fields.description:
Hey there,

the order of subpages seem to be inconsistent between the UI and the REST API.

*Steps to reproduce:*

# Create a new parent page
# Add 3 subpages to that page with these page titles: [A], B and [C]

*What happens:*
In the confluence UI the order of these pages are displayed this way: [A], [C], B

When fetching the subpages through REST _(/wiki/rest/api/content/<parentNodeId>/child/page)_ the order of the subpages is like this: [A], B, [C]

*What should happen:*
The order of the subpages should be consistent between what's displayed in confluence and what's returned via REST.
fields.summary: Inconsistent order of child pages when using the REST API
Release 1.0

fields.description:
While developing a dynamic content macro, I'm unable to get confluence to use a changed URL of the macro icon (in the descriptor JSON: modules -> dynamicContentMacros -> [0] -> icon -> url).

I tried changing the URL and reinstalling the addon, both just now and over a week ago, but it still uses the icon URL that I first provided when installing the descriptor for the very first time in the UI.

Clearing the browser data resolves the issue, but I guess this should also work if not all customers clear their browser data regularly? I was not able to find out where this was stored and had to remove browsing data for the past 4 weeks (removing all the data from the Atlassian domains wasn't enough).
fields.summary: Dynamic content macro icon URL not changing

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Our plugin, "Approval Macro for Confluence", relies on the Connect Framework to provide a user picker.
One of our customers has come back to us with the following bug:
"A user who has page edit and adding privileges can add the Approval Macro, but cannot add names.
For example, someone creates a page that requires employee X (who has add privileges) to review the document. She determines that employee Y must be added to approve. She can add the Approval Macro, but when she tries to search for employee Y – or any employee – nothing is populated. The site administrator has to make the changes for her."
As the user picker's code is entirely on Atlassian's end, we cannot do anything to change this behaviour.
Customer's cloud site is clariusmhealth.atlassian.net

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Use Approval System Macro
# In the Approvers field, search for users
# Nothing is populated

h3. Expected Results
Get list of other users containing letters typed

h3. Actual Results
No users were found

h3. Notes
I have heard this complaint from a different customer also. I believe it may be browser/OS related, as customers are on Chrome on Windows 10, though even then it is inconsistent - sometimes functioning correctly, and sometimes not returning user results.

Can be replicated on IE 11 and Edge.
fields.summary: 'User picker' box in Confluence dynamic content macro shows no users intermittently

fields.description:
Discovered by a customer of ours. The issue appears to be related to cross-origin requests.

h3. Steps
# Create a rich-text dynamic macro that renders its contents using the {{contentbody/convert}} API.
# Place a Chart macro inside the dynamic macro in a Confluence page, and save it.
# Load the page, and see that the Chart macro doesn't appear.

*Add-on the issue was found in:* [Macro Toolbox for Cloud|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/plugins/com.addonengine.macrotoolboxforcloud/overview]
*Browser:* Chrome  59.0.3071.104 (Official Build) (64-bit)
*OS:* macOS 10.12.5
*Test Page:* https://goodsoftwarestaging.atlassian.net/wiki/x/AYBP

h3. Workarounds
None.

h3. Error Messages
The web request that causes the error is made from {{confluence.extra.chart:chart-macro-resources}} web resource.

{code}
// From Dev Console...

XMLHttpRequest cannot load https://goodsoftwarestaging.atlassian.net/wiki/plugins/servlet/chart-macro/render. Response to preflight request doesn't pass access control check: No 'Access-Control-Allow-Origin' header is present on the requested resource. Origin 'https://macro-toolbox-for-cloud.addonengine.com' is therefore not allowed access.
{code}
fields.summary: Chart macro doesn't work inside a dynamic macro

fields.description:
https://developer.atlassian.com/static/connect/docs/latest/scopes/confluence-rest-scopes.html documents that {{WRITE}} scope is needed for creating spaces (see /rest/api/space).

This is not enough though as {{confluence-users}} group will also need a {{CREATESPACE}} permission. It's relatively common for administrators to not allow normal users to create spaces by removing {{CREATESPACE}} permission from {{confluence-users}} group.

{{ADMIN}} scope cannot be used to work around this because it will grant {{atlassian-addons-admin}} group only {{ADMINISTRATECONFLUENCE}} permission, and not {{CREATESPACE}} permission (See {{com.atlassian.plugin.connect.confluence.auth.ConfluenceAddonUserProvisioningService#grantGroupAdminPermissionLocally}}).
fields.summary: Space creation sometimes not permitted with WRITE scope

# Change the start parameter to 3 and make the GET request again: *rest/api/group?start=3&limit=1*

*What happens:*

The endpoint always returns the same subset of groups, regardless what the start parameter is set to.

*What should happen:*

The endpoint should handle pagination corrently and return the right subset of groups.

fields.description:
When editing a page and unchecking the "Notify watchers" checkbox before saving the page, the {{version.minorEdit}} flag in the REST API response of {{/rest/api/content/[pageId]}} returns false where we would expect it to return true. It doesn't seem currently possible for an addon to know if a change has been made with the "Notify watchers" checkbox activated.

This is necessary for our addon "Slack for Confluence" to not send notifications if the "Notify watchers" checkbox has been deactivated. We've had numerous customers ask for this feature, but cannot currently implement it.
fields.summary: minorEdit flag in REST API response not set when editing a page with deactivated "Notify watchers" checkbox

fields.description:
I've used a dataUri in the UI support of my 'confluenceContentProperties' to allow my add-on to provide data for the autocomplete dropdown in the search screen.

When the browser makes the call, no JWT token is sent to the remote dataUri. This way an add-on is unable to provide tenant specific autocomplete data.
fields.summary: Content property filters with a remote data source do not get an JWT token

I expect this will result in the macro producing 404's in some of its code paths. In general, the base url of Confluence should be worked out dynamically in code, instead of statically.
fields.summary: Replace static references to '/confluence' in the content formatting plugin

fields.description:
If add-on A and add-on B each have a macro with the same key, and the following actions are taken (in this order):
1. A is installed
2. B in installed
3. A is disabled or uninstalled

Then the macro will not render, and Confluence will instead return an error that the macro does not exist. If add-on B is then disabled/reenabled, then the macro will render properly again.

I realize that it is recommended that the macro key be globally unique, but this is not always the case and it is very difficult for the user to know why this error is occurring or how to fix it.
fields.summary: Errors when two add-ons have macro with the same key

fields.description:
The macro property panel tries to validate that a control is correctly bound to a valid parameter.

It does this by building a map of parameters-->paraterBean, it doesnt consider the case when a single addon could have to macros that share a parameter name.

To fix this we need to change the AbstractContentMacroModuleProvider#getDeclaredMacroParameters to return a list or at least key on something which includes the addonKey
fields.summary: Macro Property Panel validation fails when two macros have the same parameter name

fields.description:
h3. Summary
If a page has a long title (tested with >150 characters), any page under it won't show its buttons (edit, save for later, watch, and •••)

h3. Environment
* Confluence Cloud

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a page with a long title. E.g.: "This page has a very very very very very very very very very long name in such a way it will bug the edit, save, watch and more buttons for any page under it"
# Create a page under it
# Access this last page

h3. Expected Results
The page's buttons (edit, save for later, watch, and •••) should appear 

h3. Actual Results
The buttons will be placed beyond the page's borders
 
h3. Notes
Depending on screen resolution, the number of characters to reproduce this bug may be different.

h3.Workaround
There're two workarounds available:
* Rename the parent page to a shorter title;
* Change the page zoom (usually *command* + *\-* / *ctrl* + *\-*);
fields.summary: Page buttons won't appear if parent page has a long title

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Customers who have added the Trello Power-up Macros to their Confluence pages have noticed that they are not visible when the Page is Exported to PDF or Word Doc

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create and Publish a Confluence page with a Trello macro
# Export the Page to PDF/Word Doc

h3. Expected Results
Trello Board is visible in the Export

h3. Actual Results
Page View in Confluence:
 !PageView.png|thumbnail!  

Viewing the Exported PDF:
 !PDFExport.png|thumbnail! 

Viewing the Exported Word Doc
!WordExport.png|thumbnail! 
 
h3. Notes
Usually Chrome's Print to PDF works however the Trello Macros are not visible using that method either

h3.Workaround
Screenshot the Trello board and attach the Screenshot(s) as a Static Image
fields.summary: Trello Macros Not Visible on Page Export

fields.description:

unknown

fields.description:
For organizations running multiple service desk with multiple customers, a feature to allow customers self-signup to a specific service desk portal would be great. Currently, this can only be done by adding the customers to the specific service desk project but this would mean more resources.

Having the customers self-signup would reduce the time and resource spent in doing this.
fields.summary: Allow service desk customer self sign-up to individual portals

fields.description:
h3. Summary
* Macros related to third party add-ons stopped working. Users getting "500 Internal Server Error".

h3. Steps to Reproduce

# Install a third-party add-on (example: Better Code Macro for Confluence, Draw.io, Smartdraw).
# In a new page, try to adding a macro for that add-on
# Publish the page.

h3. Expected Results
* The macro loads normally after publishing the page.

h3. Actual Results
* A 500 Internal Server Error is thrown on the Browser developer tool. 
* And the error "App is not responding. Wait or cancel? " is showing up 


h3. Notes
* Changing the browser does not fix the issue.

h3.Workaround
* Currently there is no workaround.
fields.summary: Unable to load macros related to third party add-ons in Confluence

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When creating a table with Widget Connector inside an Expander on a table cell, if you try to copy and paste a row with the editor tools, it'll paste the Widget Connector on a new cell. 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
Paste the Widget Connector inside the Expander
# Create a table
# Insert an Expander on a cell
# Insert a Widget Connector on the Expander
# Use the Copy Row tool
# Paste the content on a new line using the Paste Row tool

h3. Expected Results
Paste the Widget Connector inside the Expander

h3. Actual Results
The Widget Connector goes to a new cell

h3. Notes
 !1-copy_cell_with_expand_and_youtube_link.png|thumbnail!  
!2-ready_to_paste.png|thumbnail!  
!3-all_messed_up.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Workaround
Do this process manually on a single cell
fields.summary: Copy and paste a table row on the editor menu with expand and Widget Connector goes to a new cell

fields.description:
Suggestion from Customer
{quote}
 #  (like table toolbar vs find&replace toolbar) add extra drop down to the
toolbar which allows us to decide which should be displayed
 # Display new toolbar blow the one which were displayed earlier (so that
the buttons stay where they were, and not jump between positions
potentially causing unintended actions)


 # Keep find&replace visible and hide table toolbar until find&replace is
closed, because table creations is more mundane level/lower priority task
and if you do find&replace you are very likely not editing tables at the
same time.\{quote}
fields.summary: Ability to switch between table toolbar vs find&replace toolbar

fields.description:
Sometimes the amount of labeled pages becomes higher than being comfortable for being displayed. The max setting already can be used to limit the amount of displayed page links. 

But it would be nice to have an optional navigation which allows to move bulkwise forward/backward.

At least an information would be necessary to state if yet more than the showed page links have been found whith the current filtering – as a hint, that an individual search might be of interest or just to make clear that there are still more entries in the back. F.e. this would be needed for review or any kind of todo labels.
fields.summary: Content by label macro should provide navigation to previous/next n entries

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
There is no way for an administrator to see which spaces are accessible for their users in a user friendly way.
To do so right now, the administrator has to go check each space permissions and compare with a user group membership to confirm if they have access or not.

h3. Suggested Solution
 
Add a way to check from the user profile which space a user can access.
A bit like in Jira with https://URL.atlassian.net/secure/admin/roles/ViewUserProjectRoles.jspa?name=<username>
This is useful to administrator to see if users have proper access or not.

h3. Workaround 
None.
fields.summary: List spaces that are accessible for users in their profile

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Adding Content by Label (or Content by User) macro after an Horizontal rule makes the macro disappear after publishing in Firefox. 

h3. Environment
* Confluence Cloud
* Firefox versions 60.0.1, 60.0.2

h3. Steps to Reproduce
* Add a Horizontal rule to the page by clicking the '+' > Horizontal rule.
* Under the Horizontal rule, add a Content by Label macro by using \{Content by Label\} or '+' > Other macros > Content by Label macro.
* Edit the macro and click on preview to check the results that should appear.
* Insert the macro.
* Publish the page.

h3. Expected Results
* The page shows the macro with the results.

h3. Actual Results
* The content of the macro does not show under the Horizontal rule.

h3. Other information
* Same happens with Content by User macro.

h3. Workaround
* After adding the Horizontal rule, hit Enter at least two times before adding the macro when using Firefox.
* Use another browser.
fields.summary: Content by Label macro added after Horizontal rule makes macro content disappear in Firefox

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When clicking on the Create button in Confluence, there are several options. You can create Blank Pages, Blog Posts, Questions, Calendars and a lot of different templates. There's no template to create a Page Tree though.

h3. Expectation
To have a template which would create a Page Tree based on the user input.

h3. Example
Let's assume that we have below hierarchy of pages to be created:
{panel}
Root
1 - Alfa
1.1 - Beta
1.2 - Gama
1.2.1 - Delta
2 - Epsilon
2.1 - Zeta
3 - Eta
3.1 - Theta
3.1.1 - Lambda
3.1.2 - Pi
3.2 - Sigma
{panel}

h4. Current Behaviour
We would need to create page by page, manually. Also, we would need to pay attention to the hierarchy when creating pages in order to create child pages under their parent pages to achieve our needs. It works but represents lots of manual work depending on the user need.

h4. Expected Behaviour
To insert a tree structure like the one above in a Macro and chill-out while Confluence does all the work.

h3. Workaround
Use the [Copy Page Tree|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/apps/22929/copy-page-tree?hosting=cloud&tab=overview] add-on.
fields.summary: Create a Page Tree from a Template

fields.description:
The page link in the side navigation should be returned. It is helpful for navigating and reordering the pages.

 !image (1).png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Keep page link in the navigation side bar

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
When a list of issues is inserted using the JIRA Issue/Filter, it's not possible to select the individual view (show the list as each individual issues), only the table view is available.

h3. Suggested Solution
Allow the individual view to be selected for a list of issues.

h3. Workaround

fields.summary: Allow single issue view mode for issue list on JIRA Issue/Filter macro

fields.description:

So that any/all reports that display burndown macros always continues to display burndown charts for inactive/completed sprints.
fields.summary: Ability to view burndown chart for inactive or completed sprints

fields.description:
h3. Summary

If you are pasting images directly from an image editing program from the clipboard into a Confluence Page, you will see that the image is pasted as an attached image. If you do this with multiple images, then all images will be displayed as the last image that was pasted in.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 - Create a page or open an existing page for editing.
 - Copy an image via an image capture tool and save to clipboard. Paste the clipboard content to the page
 - Repeat the above step at least a couple to times to get at least two images, the preview should show the distinct pasted images correctly.
 - Save the page.

h3. Expected Results

The images show up as separate and distinct images, as indicated by the preview before save.
h3. Actual Results

You will end up with all images that were added this way being displayed as the last image that was pasted this way.
h3. Notes

This does not happen if you upload the image as an actual file.
All pasted images have the same default filename *image.png*
h3. Workaround

At this time, the only workaround is to save the image and upload it as a file.
fields.summary: Pasting multiple images from Clipboard overwrites all images to the latest one

fields.description:
*Summary*
 * Removing a numbered list from a section in Confluence page, froze the section and no more content can be added to it.

*Steps To Reproduce*
 * Edit the page
 * Add a section
 * Write: " 1." then hit space
 * This triggers the numbered list to start
 * Hit on backspace to delete "1." and stop the numbered list
 * Re-write "1." then hit space, then hit on backspace,

*Expected Result*
 * Able to add the numbered list again

*Actual Result*
 * Section becomes unresponsive, with an extra space added to it. Video attached.

*Work Around*
 * Publish the page and edit the page for the section to become responsive.
fields.summary: Manipulating a numbered list twice can lead to non-interactive layout sections.

fields.description:

They have to create a Server Confluence, use an Add-on to import the content from Evernote and then migrate to a Cloud Instance. 
They can import .doc files directly to a single Cloud Page but it's not viable for a large number of documents.

It would be very helpful to import the Evernote files, or packages, directly to Confluence Cloud.
fields.summary: Support for Evernote import in Cloud

fields.description:
h3. Environment
* user A: space admin in site A
* user B: space admin in site B(not included in site-admin)

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# user A creates a space and set restrictions for the Overview page to show it only to user A
# Export the space in XML format
# Import 2 to another instance with user B
# Access the space setting of that space
# Navigate to "Permissions" -> "Restricted Pages" and click the key icon to remove the restriction

h3. Expected Results
User is able to remove the restriction with no errors

h3. Actual Results
1. The following error is shown. 
 !スクリーンショット 2018-06-12 16.57.36.png|thumbnail! 
2. When click "Request access", the following error is shown.
 !スクリーンショット 2018-06-12 16.58.14.png|thumbnail! 

*Even if you see these errors, the restrictions are actually removed.*
You can confirm this by navigating back to the "Restricted Pages" tab and refresh the page

Though, I suggest opening the links in a new tab when clicking the key icon to do perform the operations quickly.

fields.description:
h3. Summary  

* When clicking to open an inline comment, it will load for the first time on the page, but without loading the replies to it. If you move around to other comments and come back to this broken inline comment, it won't be displayed anymore.

h3. Steps to Reproduce 
# Open a specific inline comment on a Confluence page;
# Navigate to other inline comments until you get back to the first inline comment you've opened.

h3. Expected Results
* The inline comment will open up, along with its replies.

h3. Actual Results 
* The inline comment won't open, as well as its replies; the comment itself loads for the first time you access it, but after navigating to other comments, the only way to see the broken inline comment again is refreshing the page.
* The following error is triggered in the Developer Tools:

{code}
templates.soy.js:491 Uncaught TypeError: t is not a function
    at Object.showmoreReply (templates.soy.js:491)
    at e.renderExpendButton (reply-list.js:110)
    at e.renderCollapsibleReplies (reply-list.js:97)
    at e.render (reply-list.js:71)
    at e.fetchComplete (reply-list.js:44)
    at e.<anonymous> (batch.js?externals=__local-default__&locale=en-GB:1142)
    at e.<anonymous> (batch.js?externals=__local-default__&locale=en-GB:1039)
    at x (batch.js?externals=__local-default__&locale=en-GB:1145)
    at e.trigger (batch.js?externals=__local-default__&locale=en-GB:1143)
    at Object.a.success (batch.js?externals=__local-default__&locale=en-GB:1160)
{code}

h3.Workaround 
* To view the inline comment itself, refresh the page;
* To view its replies, N/A
fields.summary: Inline comments are broken

fields.description:
*Summary*

When a link to the old version of a page is added to the current of the very same page, clicking on to the link will result in a blank page. 

*Steps to Reproduce*

* Select a Version of the page from *Page History* expect current version
* Copy the link of the old version
* Add the link to the Current Version, publish the page.
* Click on the link of the old version

*Expected Result*

* Old version of the page will open

*Actual Result*

* Click on to the link will result in a blank page. Console error screenshot attached.
* OR in a 404 page not found.

*Workaround*

* *Refresh the page*, will open the old version of the page or follow these steps
* Create a Copy of the Current Page, Copy created.
* Navigate to the Orginal Page> Select the required Version from the Page History
* Choose Restore this Version
* Copy the URL of this old version
* Add this URL to the Copy of Original Page. 
* Now when you click the Link, you will be able to view the old version of the page.
fields.summary: Link to a previous version of the page, will result in a blank page.

fields.description:
h3. Summary  

* When accessing a space through the URL and the space key is in lower case, it won't redirect to the space itself.

h3. Steps to Reproduce 
# Create a space with the key *TEST*
# Try to access it through the URL https://<instance-name>.atlassian.net/wiki/spaces/test

h3. Expected Results  
* Be redirected to https://<instance-name>.atlassian.net/wiki/spaces/TEST/overview

h3. Actual Results 
* It loads a blank page and is stuck in it.

h3. Notes 
* Although space keys are case sensitive (you can either create them being in lower or upper case), you cannot create two spaces with the same space key, one in lower case and the other in upper case, since Confluence compares the space keys in the instance in their lower case form/

h3.Workaround 
* Access the URL through https://<instance-name>.atlassian.net/wiki/spaces/TEST/overview
fields.summary: Space key is case sensitive on URL

fields.description:
h3. Description
Adding multiple labels, the cursor goes to 'Add' button instead of cleared label data box.

h3. Environment
* Confluence Cloud
* Chrome, Firefox, Safari (Safari has a different behaviour)

h3. Steps to Reproduce
* Add multiple labels to a blog post or page.
* On another blog post or page, open the Labels window by clicking the pencil icon.
* Start typing a label in the data entry box.
* A list of possible previously used labels appears.
* Use the down arrow to highlight the desired label.
* Press Enter.
* The full label is populated in the label box.
* Press the Right Tab to select the Add button.
* Press Enter to add the label to the list for the page.
* The data entry box is cleared.

h3. Expected Results
* The cursor should go to the cleared data entry box for typing another label.

h3. Actual Results
* On *Chrome* and *Firefox*, the cursor stays on the Add button.
* Start typing another label: because the cursor is on the Add button, control goes somewhere else and the Label window goes away. As a result, to add more labels, the user must navigate back to the blog and scroll down to the Add Label (pencil) icon.

* On *Safari*, the cursor goes to the page URL instead of Add after selecting the first label. After the first label is added, the tab goes to the label(s) already added and then to the page URL, never reaching the Add button. 

h3. Workaround
* Add a mouse click or hit the tab key several times until the cursor is back in the data entry box.
fields.summary: Adding multiple labels: cursor goes to 'Add' button instead of cleared label data box

fields.description:

Remove the macro from the list.

fields.description:
When Adding a Jira Issue Macro to a page in Confluence for a single issue, typically an Issue link (mentioned in) is created and this counts as an Update to that issue (so the last updated value for the issue is updated as well).

As there is currently no way to filter out specific events with JQL to see a more relevant Last updated time for issues, it would be nice to be able to opt-out of the automatic update in the JIRA issue.

This will allow issues to be more accurately viewed for a lack of updates.
fields.summary: Add Option to not update Jira issue when adding Jira Issue Macro for single issues

fields.description:
Some recent changes are now causing a whitespace on all spaces that are themed.

See original issue for details: [https://ecosystem.atlassian.net/browse/CE-1193]
fields.summary: Extra margin causing "whitespace" when theming is applied
Table Scrollbar (for wide tables) to be shown from the edit mode.

fields.description: Currently, if a customer has a wide table in the page. The table scrollbar will appear when you are viewing it but it doesn't when opening the page in editing mode. It would be useful if user is able to control the scrollbar when opening the page in editing mode to provide flexibility when editing a table with huge data.
fields.summary: Table Scrollbar (for wide tables) to be shown from the edit mode.

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Add a table inside a dynamic macro and only the text is rendered; no lines nor color.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create an app with dynamic macros that accepts content
# Insert a normal table inside the macro
# Publish

h3. Expected Results
Tables are displayed properly

h3. Actual Results
 !Dynamic_macros_with_tables.jpg|thumbnail! 

h3.Workaround
Handle the lines and color via CSS.
fields.summary: Displaying tables inside dynamic macros does not work

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When creating a New Page in Confluence, a User may want to attach an Office Document and display it using one of the Office Macros
If they've created a New Page and uploaded the Office Document to it, the corresponding Office Macro does not find the Attachment

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a New Page
# Upload an Office Document (in this example, using a Word Doc) either by Dragging and Dropping or going through the + > File and Images menu
# Add the Office Word Macro and select the Attached file

h3. Expected Results

h3. Actual Results
The Office Macro does not display the Attached Office Document
 !OfficeMacro.png|thumbnail! 
 
h3. Notes
Subsequent Edits to the page does not show this same issue; if editing an Existing Page, the Office Macro is able to find the file

h3.Workaround
Publish the Page and then the Macro should see the Attachment
fields.summary: Office Macro in Confluence Does Not Show Attached Files on Unpublished Page
